story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled at the foot of the Himalayas, there lived a kind and gentle little girl named Priya. She had a loving family, who owned a small farm and worked hard every day to tend to their crops and animals.

Priya's favorite time of day was early in the morning, just as the sun was beginning to rise. She would tiptoe out of her cozy bedroom, careful not to wake her parents or her younger brother, and make her way to the backyard. There, she would sit cross-legged in front of a small, rectangular stone that her family called the "whispering stone."

The whispering stone was said to be magical, and Priya believed it with all her heart. She had been told that if she listened closely, she could hear the distant whisper of the mountains, the rustling of leaves, and the gentle murmur of the wind.

One day, as Priya sat cross-legged in front of the whispering stone, she heard something truly magical. It was a tiny, high-pitched voice, singing a beautiful melody. Intrigued, she followed the sound and soon found herself at the edge of a small pond, where she saw the most amazing sight.

There, floating on a lily pad, was a tiny fairy no bigger than a thumb. She had delicate wings that sparkled in the morning light and her hair was as golden as the sun. The fairy continued to sing her beautiful song, and Priya listened in awe.

When the fairy finished her song, she looked up and saw Priya. She smiled and introduced herself as Lila, the fairy of the Himalayas. She told Priya that she was a guardian of the mountains and that her voice was said to have the power to heal sick animals and soothe troubled minds.

Priya and Lila quickly became the best of friends, and every morning, Priya would visit the pond to listen to Lila's enchanting music. In return, Priya would share stories of her life in the village and all the love and kindness that her family had taught her.

One day, Lila asked Priya if she would help her with a very important task. She told Priya that an evil sorcerer had cast a spell on the Himalayas, causing all the animals to fall sick. She needed Priya's help to break the spell, as her voice alone was not enough.

Priya agreed to help, and the two friends set out on a journey to find the sorcerer's lair. They climbed steep mountains, crossed treacherous rivers, and trudged through deep snow. Along the way, they met many sick animals, and Priya cared for them as best as she could.

When they finally reached the sorcerer's lair, they found him sitting on a throne, gloating over his evil deeds. Lila bravely confronted him and used her enchanting voice to sing the most beautiful and powerful song that Priya had ever heard.

The sorcerer was so moved by Lila's song that he immediately regretted his actions and promised to reverse the spell. He kept his word, and soon all the animals were healthy again. Priya and Lila returned to the village, where they were hailed as heroes.

From that day on, Priya and Lila remained the best of friends, and the whispering stone was never the same again. It was no longer just a stone, but a magical portal that connected Priya to the wonders of the world.

And every night, as Priya closed her eyes to sleep, she whispered stories of her adventures to the stone, knowing that Lila was listening on the other side of the magical veil.

So, dear daughter, whenever you feel lost or alone, remember the story of Priya and Lila, and know that the whispers of the wind and the song of the mountains are always there to guide you. Goodnight, my dear. Dream of the magical world that awaits you, and always remember how much your family loves and cherishes you.
